required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relative Bioavailability and Tolerability of Various Experimental Formulations of BIBV 308 SE in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Relative Bioavailability and Tolerability of Various Experimental Formulations of 50 mg BIBV 308 SE Administered Orally Twice a Day Over 3.5 Days to Healthy Subjects (Intraindividual Comparison, Open, Partially Randomised).

brief_summary.textblock: Comparative pharmacokinetics of 2-4 experimental modified release formulations and oral solution of BIBV 308 SE following multiple doses, tolerability

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma at steady state (AUCss)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 84 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum measured concentration of the analyte in plasma at steady state (Cmax,ss)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 84 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Minimum measured concentration of the analyte in plasma at steady state (Cmin,ss)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 84 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 84 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from dosing to the maximum concentration of the analyte in plasma at steady state (tmax,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 84 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean residence time of the analyte in the body (MRTtot)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 84 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent clearance of the analyte in plasma (CL/f)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 84 hours after drug administration
up to 84 hours after drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough concentrations of BIBV 308 SE before doses

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects that were previously entered in at least one BIBV 308 SE study to ensure that it is known how these subjects absorb BIBV 308 SE
- Healthy subjects as determined by results of screening
- Signed written informed consent in accordance with Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and local legislation
- Age >= 18 and <= 55 years
- Broca >= -20% and <= +20 %
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poor individual absorption kinetics of BIBV 308 SE in previous studies
- Any findings of the medical examination (including blood pressure, pulse rate and Electrocardiogram (ECG)) deviating from normal and of clinical relevance
- Gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunological or hormonal disorders
- Surgery of the gastro-intestinal tract (except appendectomy)
- Diseases of the central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders
- Chronic or relevant acute infections
- Hypersensitivity to BIBV 308 SE and any of the excipients
- Intake of drugs with a long half-life (> 24 hours) <= 1 month prior to administration or during the trial
- Use of any drugs which might influence the results of the trial <= 10 days prior to administration or during the trial
- Participation in another trial with an investigational drug <= 2 months days prior to administration or during the trial
- Smoker (>= 10 cigarettes or >= 3 cigars or >= 3 pipes/day)
- Inability to refrain from smoking on study days
- Known alcohol or drug abuse
- Blood donation <= 1 month prior to administration
- Excessive physical activities <= 5 days prior to administration
- History of hemorrhagic diathesis
- History of gastro-intestinal ulcer, perforation or bleeding
- History of bronchial asthma
- Any laboratory value outside the reference range of clinical relevance
